title: Dragons in Spirituality: A Complete (& Fiery) Guide

steps.title: Inner strength and power
steps.content: Inner strength and power Dragons are symbols of ultimate might and wrath but also represent a responsibility to tame that power. As you work with dragon energy, learn to awaken your inner strength to meet your challenges. [1] X Research source Get on the path to self-realization by mastering the dragon forces inside you. Western Europeans were obsessed with “slaying” dragons, but you can instead tame their power to serve you in life best.

steps.title: Spiritual guidance and wisdom
steps.content: Spiritual guidance and wisdom Dragons remind us that divinity exists in all things. As dragons guide you towards success, it’s important to remember that they also guide you toward enlightenment. [2] X Research source In the ancient world, it was believed that dragons existed spiritually within landscapes on the earth. Some Europeans believed that dragons actually lived inside mountains and other forms of land.

steps.title: Transformation and change
steps.content: Transformation and change Encountering a dragon as a spirit animal means you’re about to go through some kind of change. The change may involve shifting beliefs or behaviors internally or finding a new job, home, or relationship externally. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Balance of energies
steps.content: Balance of energies Dragons are an example of polarities at work. They have been considered a force of good in Eastern culture and a source of evil in Western culture. Dragons as symbols force you to consider the good and evil energies inside yourself. [4] X Research source Think about how you use the yin-yang energies inside you. Are your opposites balanced or are you looking at a situation in a one-sided way? Dragons allow us to meet ourselves in the center and remain aware of balance within ourselves.

steps.title: Protection
steps.content: Protection Dragons are thought of as guardians who protect the treasure. This meant a literal treasure of gold in Western culture but deciphers dragons as guardians of enlightenment in Eastern culture. [5] X Research source On the flip side of protection is greed. Dragons who guard a treasure can sometimes be seen as hoarding it, which reminds us not to give into greed or over-protection in ourselves.

steps.title: Mystery and magic
steps.content: Mystery and magic Dragons are mythical creatures that symbolize the magic of everyday life. Use this energy to embrace the more mystical side of life, whether that means starting a dream journal, learning a new meditation practice, or embarking on a spiritual journey. [6] X Research source Curious what mythical creature you're most similar to? Maybe it's a dragon! Take our What Mythical Creature Am I quiz to find out.

steps.title: Different colored dragons have different meanings in Eastern culture.
steps.content: Different colored dragons have different meanings in Eastern culture. The dragon’s particular color affects the type of power it yields and how people use the dragon to visualize their goals and hope for good luck. [7] X Research source Red dragons are most commonly linked to good luck and fortune. White dragons are thought of as a symbol of purity and virtue. Black dragons traditionally represent evil or revenge. Green or blue dragons signal the coming of spring and symbolize new life. Yellow or golden dragons signal prosperity and are a sign of good luck. [8] X Research source

steps.title: There are 4 elemental types of dragons, and each represents something different.
steps.content: There are 4 elemental types of dragons, and each represents something different. Whether the dragon you're dealing with spiritually appears in the water, on land, in the air, or breathing fire can make a difference in what it means. [9] X Research source Water dragons speak to emotional rhythms. Many dragon characters are ocean dwellers, who can teach us to go with the flow more. They link us to the deeper unconscious, intuition, and feminine wisdom. Work to make your inner unconscious part of your everyday reality with the motion of water. Earth dragons stand for ancient earth energy. They are associated with eternal wisdom and mastery over time. Connect to your earth dragon by walking in the forest and reflecting on being solid and grounded in nature. Fire dragons signal passion and creative energy. Their home is usually inside a volcanic mountain or near the sun, where they keep the fiery energy of love and the heart with them. Air dragons can expand your spiritual horizons. They usually appear as winged creatures flying through the clouds. Air dragons assist you in ascending to a new perspective of thought or emotion without fear. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Asian dragons are a benevolent symbol of good luck and prosperity.
steps.content: Asian dragons are a benevolent symbol of good luck and prosperity. In Chinese mythology, Yandi, a tribal leader, is born out of a dragon's telepathy with his mother. Along with Huangdi, the grandson of a dragon, these emperors are China’s ancestors. The story goes that both Yandi and Huangdi became dragons after they died, which makes Chinese people “the descendants of dragons.” [11] X Research source Dragons control water and weather in Chinese culture. Four “dragon kings” rule over water elements, like rivers, rainfall, waterfalls, and seas. Dragons are a sign of imperial authority in China. They were symbols for Chinese imperial leaders, who were called “sons of dragons.” Dragon imagery was not permitted to appear in other parts of society. The dragon is the 5th element in Chinese astrology. It’s associated with strength, good health, good luck, and male-yang energy. People born in the year of the dragon are typically intelligent, confident, powerful, charismatic, and have natural talents. [12] X Research source

steps.title: The European dragon is a malevolent force to be reckoned with.
steps.content: The European dragon is a malevolent force to be reckoned with. Unlike its Eastern counterpart, the medieval dragon in Western mythology stands for chaos and destruction and usually guards treasure or challenges that the hero (usually a knight) needs to overcome. [13] X Research source In St. George and the Dragon, the knight rescues the princess after having to slay the dragon, which demands human sacrifice. Other English folk tales find dragons hiding treasure in a dark lair, to be found in mountains, caves, or lakes. [14] X Research source The Red Dragon of Wales is an ancient symbol of Welsh resistance. Called “Y Ddraig Goch” in Welsh, it appears on the Welsh national flag. This dragon dates back to the 7th-century King Cadwaladr of Gwynedd, who carried its image into battle against the Saxons.

steps.title: Apep is an ancient Egyptian serpent dragon from the land of the dead.
steps.content: Apep is an ancient Egyptian serpent dragon from the land of the dead. Other Egyptian dragon figures include the ouroboros , a serpent dragon who eats its tail. [15] X Research source

steps.title: The drakaina is a female dragon in ancient Greek mythology.
steps.content: The drakaina is a female dragon in ancient Greek mythology. She has the features of a human woman but is not alone in Greek folktales about dragons. There is a long history of Greek heroes fighting dragons: Heracles and the Lernaean Hydra, Jason and a dragon who guarded the Golden Fleece, and Cadmus against the dragon of Ares. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Native American dragons are found on both land and sea.
steps.content: Native American dragons are found on both land and sea. They existed in caves and also appeared as winged creatures flying through the sky. The Algonquin Piasa, called the “bird dragon,” has elk’s horns, gold scales, bat-like claws, and feathery wings. This unusual dragon represents the supernatural power of the Underworld. [17] X Research source

steps.title: The French Le Drac is a dragon who is sometimes werewolf-like.
steps.content: The French Le Drac is a dragon who is sometimes werewolf-like. Le Drac lived near the Viaur River in France and was an evil figure thought of as the Devil’s son. [18] X Research source

steps.title: Dragons signal chaos in the Bible.
steps.content: Dragons signal chaos in the Bible. They are a kind of spiritual darkness that needs to be conquered. God defeats a sea dragon in the Book of Genesis, while Daniel meets a dragon slayer who can destroy dragon-like monsters threatening humankind in the Book of Daniel. [19] X Research source

steps.title: The Incan Amaru dragon guards South American waters.
steps.content: The Incan Amaru dragon guards South American waters. Also called the rainbow dragon, this serpent-dragon figure is a shapeshifter known for its wisdom to guide shamans in spiritual practices. [20] X Research source

steps.title: Dreaming of a dragon means it’s time to confront fears.
steps.content: Dreaming of a dragon means it’s time to confront fears. Reach into your unconscious to find the power to conquer these fears so you can overcome challenges. [21] X Research source Pay attention to the context in which dragons appear in your dreams. Does their presence give you a positive or negative association? The specific dream you have affects the overall message a dragon dream figure has to share. [22] X Research source

steps.title: Dragon dreams can be related to guardianship.
steps.content: Dragon dreams can be related to guardianship. The dragon is a protector, so ask yourself what you need during this phase of life, who you can trust, and how best to protect your energy from negative influences. [23] X Research source

steps.title: Eastern Dragons are considered signs of good luck and fortune.
steps.content: Eastern Dragons are considered signs of good luck and fortune. They are a huge part of traditional Chinese New Year celebrations and are considered a benevolent symbol for a year filled with prosperity and wealth. [24] X Research source

steps.title: Western European dragons are associated with bad omens, evil, and even the devil.
steps.content: Western European dragons are associated with bad omens, evil, and even the devil. As symbols, they guard treasure, breathe fire, and need to be defeated by angels or knights. [25] X Research source The good or bad omen depends on which dragon you connect to most, but dragons as bringers of good fortune is a tradition that is still celebrated today.

steps.title: Connect to both your higher and lower ego self.
steps.content: Connect to both your higher and lower ego self. Your higher self connects to the divine, while your lower ego is more interested in survival. Dragons inspire us to connect with both versions of ourselves. [26] X Research source

steps.title: Embrace power in your life, confront challenges, and seek wisdom.
steps.content: Embrace power in your life, confront challenges, and seek wisdom. For help with this, engage with dragons as symbols and possible spiritual guides. You'll discover an appreciation for all that dragons represent to you along your journey. [27] X Research source

steps.title: Speak to your inner dragon by drawing or collecting dragon images.
steps.content: Speak to your inner dragon by drawing or collecting dragon images. You may even decide it’s time to get a dragon tattoo . A film, TV series, piece of art, or dragon costume you see may wake up your inner dragon, so pay attention. Through these methods, dragons encourage you to express yourself. [28] X Research source
